title: Total Property Tax Exemption for 100% Disabled Veterans
summary: Complete exemption from real property taxes on primary residence for veterans rated 100% service-connected permanently and totally disabled.

requirements.notes: Must be 100% service-connected P&T OR Individual Unemployability (IU) at 100% rate.

eligibilityNotes: Applies to primary residence and up to one acre of land. Apply through local Commissioner of the Revenue. Surviving spouses who have not remarried also qualify.

title: Personal Property Tax Exemption for One Vehicle
summary: Exemption from personal property taxes on one passenger car or pickup truck for 100% disabled veterans.

requirements.notes: Applies to one automobile or pickup truck used primarily by or for the veteran.

eligibilityNotes: Vehicle must be owned by veteran or jointly with spouse. Effective January 1, 2021. Apply through Commissioner of the Revenue. Does not transfer to surviving spouse.

title: Virginia Military Survivors & Dependents Education Program (VMSDEP)
summary: Full tuition and mandatory fees waiver at Virginia public colleges and universities for spouses and children of qualifying veterans or service members.

requirements.notes: Veteran must be 90-100% permanently disabled, or KIA/MIA/POW. Virginia must be home of record for 5+ years.

eligibilityNotes: Covers 8 semesters (4 academic years). Children must be 16-29 years old. Includes stipend for books, room, and board. Apply through DVS portal each semester.

title: Free Lifetime Hunting & Fishing License (100% Disabled)
summary: Free lifetime hunting and freshwater fishing license for Virginia resident veterans who are 100% permanently and totally disabled.
eligibilityNotes: Includes lifetime hunting license and freshwater fishing license. Additional licenses required for trout waters and state/national forests. Apply through Virginia DWR.

title: Discounted Lifetime Hunting & Fishing License (30-99% Disabled)
summary: Reduced-cost lifetime hunting and fishing licenses for Virginia resident veterans with 30-99% service-connected disabilities.
eligibilityNotes: Must be Virginia resident. Tiered pricing based on disability rating. Includes hunting and freshwater fishing. Apply through Virginia DWR.

title: Free Virginia State Parks Passport (100% Disabled)
summary: Free admission, parking, boat launch, and 50% discount on camping and rentals at all Virginia state parks for 100% disabled veterans.

requirements.notes: Does not require Virginia residency. Includes veteran and anyone needed to assist them.

eligibilityNotes: Free entry and parking for passholder and assistant. 50% discount on camping, swimming, shelters, and equipment rental. Apply at any Virginia State Park.

title: Disabled Veteran License Plates
summary: Free special license plates with disabled parking privileges for 100% permanently and totally disabled veterans.

requirements.notes: Must have permanent and total disability designation.

eligibilityNotes: Allows use of disabled parking spaces. Apply through Virginia DMV with VA documentation. Registration fees may be waived.

title: Veterans Identification Card (VIC)
summary: Special identification card available to qualified veterans for a one-time fee of $10.

requirements.notes: Available to all honorably discharged veterans.

eligibilityNotes: Issued by Virginia DMV. Can be used to verify veteran status for benefits and discounts. One-time $10 fee.

title: Commercial Driver's License (CDL) Skills Test Waiver
summary: Waiver of CDL road skills test for military personnel and veterans with 2+ years of heavy truck/bus driving experience.

requirements.notes: Must have 2+ years military heavy truck/bus driving experience. Must be separated for 12 months or less.

eligibilityNotes: Knowledge test still required. Road skills test waived for qualified military drivers. Troops to Trucks program. Apply through Virginia DMV.

title: Virginia Veterans Care Centers (State Veterans Homes)
summary: Four state-operated skilled nursing care facilities providing long-term care, dementia care, and rehabilitative services for Virginia veterans.

requirements.notes: Honorable discharge, Virginia resident at admission or entry into active duty from Virginia, must meet medical requirements for nursing home care.

eligibilityNotes: Four locations: Roanoke (Davis & McDaniel), Richmond (Sitter & Barfoot), Virginia Beach (Jones & Cabacoy), and Fauquier County (Puller - newly opened). All private rooms. VA per diem benefits help cover costs.

title: Veterans Employment Preference (State Jobs)
summary: Veterans receive preference points when applying for Virginia state government positions.

requirements.notes: 5% preference for veterans, 10% preference for service-connected disabled veterans. Purple Heart recipients and Gold Star families also receive enhanced consideration.

eligibilityNotes: State agencies must interview at least one veteran if they meet minimum qualifications. Virginia Values Veterans (V3) Program encourages veteran hiring.

title: Military Retirement Income Tax Subtraction
summary: Phased elimination of state income tax on military retirement pay for veterans age 55 and older.

requirements.notes: As of 2024, veterans 55+ can deduct up to $40,000. Increases annually toward full exemption.

eligibilityNotes: Applies to military retirement income, Survivor Benefit Plan payments, and military benefits paid to surviving spouses. Virginia is phasing out all taxes on military retirement.

title: Virginia Values Veterans (V3) Program
summary: State employment initiative encouraging veteran hiring with enhanced interview requirements for state agencies.

requirements.notes: State agencies must interview at least one veteran if they meet minimum qualifications.

eligibilityNotes: Virginia Values Veterans (V3) Program promotes veteran employment throughout state agencies. Enhanced consideration for Purple Heart recipients and Gold Star families.

title: Virginia National Guard Tuition Assistance Program
summary: State-funded tuition assistance for Virginia National Guard members.

requirements.notes: Must be active member of Virginia National Guard.

eligibilityNotes: Provides tuition assistance for Guard members attending Virginia institutions.

title: Military Retirement Income Tax Subtraction (Phased Elimination)
summary: Virginia is phasing out all state income tax on military retirement pay. Currently $40,000 deduction for age 55+, increasing toward full exemption.

requirements.notes: As of 2024: veterans 55+ can deduct up to $40,000. Amount increases annually toward full exemption.

eligibilityNotes: Applies to military retirement income, Survivor Benefit Plan payments, and military benefits paid to surviving spouses. Virginia is eliminating all taxes on military retirement over time.

title: VMSDEP Stipend for Books, Room & Board
summary: In addition to tuition waiver, VMSDEP provides stipend for books, room, and board for eligible dependents.

requirements.notes: Veteran must be 90-100% permanently disabled, or KIA/MIA/POW. Virginia must be home of record for 5+ years.

eligibilityNotes: Covers 8 semesters (4 academic years). Children must be 16-29 years old. Includes stipend beyond tuition. Apply through DVS portal each semester.

title: State Tuition Assistance Program (STAP)
summary: Up to $4,500 per semester in tuition grants for Virginia National Guard members attending accredited institutions with physical locations in Virginia.

requirements.notes: Must have minimum 2 years remaining service obligation. Must have completed required initial active duty service. Must be satisfactorily performing duty. 2-year commitment incurred upon completion of last term.

eligibilityNotes: Virginia National Guard (Army or Air) members enrolled in good standing at VA public institutions or accredited nonprofit private institutions with physical location in Virginia. Spring 2026 cap is $4,500/semester (reduced from previous $10,000 due to surge in enrollment). Covers TUITION ONLY (not fees, books, room/board). Must complete FAFSA/CASFA and maintain Satisfactory Academic Progress. Grants paid directly to school by Department of Military Affairs. Recoupment required for failed/incomplete/withdrawn courses or incomplete document packets. Apply through https://statetuition.vangweb.com. Request windows: Fall (May 15-Jul 1), Spring (Sep 15-Nov 1), Summer (Feb 15-Apr 1).
